qas.question: What large species of antelope once made its home in the desert areas of the Middle East?
Why did sport hunters find the Arabian oryx to be a worthwhile quarry to hunt?
When did the Arabian oryx become extinct in the wild due to sport hunting?
How did hunters obliterate the advantage bestowed upon the oryx by evolution?

answers.text: use of automobiles and high-powered rifles

qas.question: What animal has made a miraculous comeback and been upgraded from "extinct in the wild" to "vulnerable"?
What is a species of large antelope?
What did the large antelope species once inhabit?

answers.text: much of the desert areas of the Middle East

qas.question: What destroyed the Arabian oryx only advantage of speed.
When did the Arabian oryx become extinct?
What contributed to the Arabian oryx rise from extinct to vulnerable?
In what year was oil first drilled for in the Middle East?

plausible_answers.text: due to conservation efforts like captive breeding

qas.question: Why has the scimitar-horned oryx make a comeback?
What status has the scimitar-horned oryx been upgraded to?
What status was the addax upgraded from in 1972?
What feature in land areas of the Middle East first attracted foreign oil executives?

context: <a0_0>The <a5_0>Arabian oryx<a5_0/><a0_0/>, a species of large antelope, once inhabited <a6_0>much of the desert areas of the Middle East<a6_0/>. However, <a1_0>the species' <b14_0>striking appearance<b14_0/><a1_0/> made it (along with the closely related scimitar-horned oryx and addax) a popular quarry for sport hunters, especially foreign executives of oil companies working in the region.[citation needed] The <a3_0>use of <a7_0>automobiles and high-powered rifles<a7_0/><a3_0/> destroyed their only advantage: speed, and they became extinct in the wild exclusively due to sport hunting in <a2_0><a8_0><b10_0>1972<b10_0/><a8_0/><a2_0/>. The scimitar-horned oryx followed suit, while the addax became critically endangered. However, the <a4_0>Arabian oryx<a4_0/> has now made a comeback and been upgraded from <b13_0>“extinct in the wild”<b13_0/> to <b12_0>“vulnerable”<b12_0/> <b11_0>due to <a9_0>conservation efforts<a9_0/> like captive breeding
